details:
Citrix Bleed ([CVE-2023-4966](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-4966)) is a sensitive information disclosure vulnerability affecting Citrix Netscaler Gateway and Netscaler ADC products with a CVSS score of 9.4. 

This vulnerability can allow an unauthenticated attacker to steal session tokens via a specially crafted request and gain access to vulnerable systems. There was also a publication from security firm [Assetnote](https://www.assetnote.io/resources/research/citrix-bleed-leaking-session-tokens-with-cve-2023-4966) that provides specific details as well as proof of concept (PoC) [code](https://github.com/assetnote/exploits/tree/main/citrix/CVE-2023-4966) to exploit this vulnerability.
